story.iWant: a new Single-Page Application (SPA) project initialized with a standard folder structure and build system
story.tasks: - [ ] Initialize Next.js project with `npx create-next-app@latest the-ai-helping-tool` (AC: 1, 2, 4, 5, 6) - [ ] Select `TypeScript` - [ ] Select `ESLint` - [ ] Select `App Router` - [ ] Verify that a new Git repository is initialized (AC: 3) - [ ] Testing: Confirm `.git` directory exists and `git status` shows an initialized repository (AC: 3) - [ ] Verify basic setup runs (`npm run dev`) (AC: 5) - [ ] Testing: Run `npm run dev` and confirm application starts without errors (AC: 5) - [ ] Ensure `.gitignore` is present and appropriate (AC: 8) - [ ] Testing: Verify `.gitignore` exists and contains entries for `node_modules`, `.next`, and `.env` (AC: 8) - [ ] Confirm standard `src` directory structure (`/app`, `/components`, `/lib`, `/services`) (AC: 4) - [ ] Testing: Manually inspect project root for presence of `/app`, `/components`, `/lib`, `/services` (AC: 4) - [ ] Add basic `README.md` (if not generated) (AC: 7) - [ ] Testing: Verify `README.md` exists and contains basic setup instructions (AC: 7) - [ ] Testing: Run `npm run lint` and confirm no linting errors on initial scaffold (AC: 6)

story-context.acceptanceCriteria: 1. Given a new project is required 2. When the project is scaffolded 3. Then a new Git repository is created. 4. And a standard `src` directory structure (e.g., `components`, `pages`, `services`) is in place. 5. And a build tool (e.g., Vite, Create React App) is configured with basic build and serve scripts. 6. And a linter and formatter (e.g., ESLint, Prettier) are configured to ensure code quality. 7. And a `README.md` with setup instructions is created. 8. And a `.gitignore` file is present to exclude unnecessary files.

doc.title: The AI Helping Tool - Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: The application will be built as a Single-Page Application to provide a fluid and responsive user experience. Support for the latest stable versions of major modern browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Edge, and Safari.

doc.title: The AI Helping Tool - Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: FR24: The application shall be built as a Single-Page Application (SPA) to ensure a dynamic and interactive user experience. FR25: The application shall support the latest stable versions of leading web browsers.

doc.title: Architecture
doc.snippet: To align with the requirement for a separate Python backend, the frontend will be initialized using Next.js with TypeScript. The initial project setup will be achieved using `npx create-next-app@latest the-ai-helping-tool` and selecting TypeScript, ESLint, and App Router.

doc.title: Architecture
doc.snippet: A standard and efficient Next.js project directory layout is established: `/the-ai-helping-tool/frontend/`, containing `/app/`, `/components/`, `/lib/`, `/services/`.

doc.title: The AI Helping Tool - Epic Breakdown
doc.snippet: Goal: Establish the fundamental technical infrastructure, user account management, and secure data handling. Covers FR24 (SPA Architecture), FR25 (Browser Compatibility), FR26 (Basic SEO).

doc.title: The AI Helping Tool - Epic Breakdown
doc.section: Story 1.1: Project Initialization and SPA Scaffolding
doc.snippet: As a developer, I want a new Single-Page Application (SPA) project initialized with a standard folder structure and build system, so that I can begin development efficiently.

doc.title: The AI Helping Tool UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: Material UI was chosen as the design system foundation for its comprehensive component library, strong accessibility features, and ease of customization, providing a solid and efficient foundation for a web application.

doc.title: The AI Helping Tool UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: The strategy ensures a consistent, intuitive, and accessible experience across all devices. Breakpoint strategy (Material UI inspired) for mobile, tablet, and desktop layouts. WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance is a core goal.

constraints.constraint: Project Structure: Standard Next.js directory layout (/frontend, /app, /components, /lib, /services)

tests.standards: Multi-layered: Unit (Pytest, Jest), Integration, and E2E (Cypress/Playwright). Initial project setup should allow for future integration of these frameworks.
tests.locations: To be determined with project structure, but likely 'frontend/__tests__/' and 'backend/tests/'.
